appDescription: A progressive web app that helps users track workouts, monitor progress, and get AI-powered training recommendations.

dashboard.name: Dashboard
dashboard.description: The main overview page showing workout statistics and quick actions
features: View total workouts completed
See this week's workout count
Track total exercises available
Monitor average workout duration
Quick access to start new workout
Recent workouts list showing last 5 completed sessions
Active workout indicator (if a workout is in progress)
Progress overview with workout streak and weekly goal tracker
AILA AI assistant card to access AI recommendations and chat
dashboard.usage: Users land here after opening the app. It provides an at-a-glance view of their fitness progress and quick navigation to key features.

workoutTracker.name: Workout Tracker
workoutTracker.description: The main workout logging interface where users track their exercises in real-time
features: Add exercises to the current session
Log sets with reps and weight for each exercise
Built-in timer that tracks workout duration
Mark sets as completed with checkboxes
Add notes to individual sets
Complete workout to save it to history
Cancel workout if needed
Weight units display based on user preference (kg or lb)
workflow: 1. User clicks 'Start New Workout' from Dashboard or navigates to Workout Tracker
2. User adds exercises from their saved library using the 'Add Exercise' button
3. For each exercise, user can add multiple sets
4. As user performs each set, they input reps and weight, then mark it complete
5. Timer runs automatically to track total workout duration
6. When finished, user clicks 'Complete Workout' to save to history
7. Workout data is stored in localStorage and used for progress tracking and AI recommendations
workoutTracker.usage: This is where users spend most of their active training time. The timer and set completion make it easy to track workouts in real-time at the gym.

progress.name: Progress
progress.description: Detailed view of workout history and exercise-specific progress tracking
features: Filter workouts by date range (Last 7 days, Last 30 days, Last 90 days, All time)
View complete workout history with dates and durations
Track exercise progress over time with charts
See max weight lifted for each exercise
Monitor volume trends (sets × reps × weight)
View last session data for each exercise
Weight displayed in user's preferred unit (kg or lb)
progress.usage: Users visit this page to analyze their training history, identify strength gains, and track progress on specific exercises. It helps users see trends and make data-driven decisions about their training.

aiRecommendations.name: AI Recommendations
aiRecommendations.description: AI-powered training insights and chat interface with AILA
features: Get AI-generated workout recommendations based on history
Filter recommendations by muscle group or category
Chat with AILA (AI Personal Trainer) for fitness advice
AI analyzes workout patterns to suggest progressions
Recommendations include weight increases, exercise variations, and recovery advice
AI has web search capabilities for latest fitness research and information
Chat history is maintained for contextual conversations
View stats: total workouts, exercises tracked, number of recommendations
aiCapabilities: Analyzes workout history to detect patterns and plateaus
Suggests weight progressions when user shows consistent performance
Recommends exercise variations to prevent boredom and target weak points
Identifies when rest/recovery is needed based on training frequency
Provides form tips and technique advice through chat
Can search the web for current fitness research, nutrition info, and supplement facts
Maintains conversation context to provide personalized advice
Respects user's weight unit preference (kg or lb) in all recommendations
aiRecommendations.usage: Users can get automated recommendations by clicking 'Get AI Recommendations' or have natural conversations with AILA in the chat. The AI considers their complete workout history and progress data to give personalized advice.

settings.name: Settings
settings.description: Manage exercises, workouts, and user preferences

exercises.name: Exercises
features: View all saved exercises in alphabetical order
Add new custom exercises with name, category, muscle groups, equipment, and instructions
Edit existing exercises inline
Delete exercises (only if not used in workout history)
Search and filter exercises by name or category

workouts.name: Workouts
features: View all completed workouts
Delete individual workouts with confirmation
See workout date, duration, and exercise count
Warning system prevents accidental deletion of workout history

preferences.name: Preferences
features: Set weight unit preference (Kilograms or Pounds)
Default is kilograms
Preference is saved to localStorage
All weight displays across the app update to match preference
AI recommendations and chat use the selected weight unit

settings.usage: Users access Settings from the dropdown menu (not in mobile bottom nav) to customize their exercise library, manage workout history, and set preferences like weight units.

dataStorage.description: All user data is stored locally in the browser
dataTypes: Workouts: Complete history of all workout sessions
Exercises: Custom and default exercise library
Progress: Aggregated progress data for each exercise
AI Recommendations: Cached recommendations to avoid unnecessary API calls
Chat History: Conversation with AILA (persists during session)
dataStorage.important: Data is stored locally, so it persists across sessions but is tied to the browser. Clearing browser cache will delete all data.

mobile: Bottom navigation bar with Dashboard, Workout, Progress, and AI Recommendations
Settings accessed via hamburger menu (excluded from bottom nav for space)

workoutWorkflow.description: Complete workflow from starting a workout to viewing AI insights
steps: 1. User starts on Dashboard and sees overview of their stats
2. User clicks 'Start New Workout' to begin a training session
3. In Workout Tracker, user adds exercises from their library
4. User logs sets with reps and weight as they train
5. User presses the start button to start the timer which tracks total workout duration
6. User marks sets complete as they go
8. Workout is saved to history and localStorage
9. User can view detailed progress on Progress page
10. User visits AI Recommendations to get insights on their training
11. AI analyzes patterns and suggests progressions, variations, or recovery
12. User can chat with AILA for specific questions or advice
13. User can adjust preferences and manage exercises in Settings

commonQuestions.howToStart: Click 'Start New Workout' on the Dashboard, then add exercises from your library and start logging sets.
commonQuestions.howToAddExercise: Go to Settings > Exercises tab > Click 'Add Exercise' button and fill in the details. Or use the + icon next to 'Add Exercise' in Workout Tracker to quickly add an exercise while logging a workout.
commonQuestions.howToTrackProgress: Visit the Progress page to see your workout history and exercise-specific charts showing weight and volume trends.
commonQuestions.howToGetAIAdvice: Go to AI Recommendations and either click 'Get AI Recommendations' for automated insights or click the AILA image to chat.
commonQuestions.howToChangeWeightUnits: Go to Settings > Preferences tab > Select your preferred unit (kg or lb).
commonQuestions.whereIsMyData: All data is stored locally in your browser's localStorage. It persists across sessions but won't sync between devices.
commonQuestions.canIDeleteWorkouts: Yes, go to Settings > Workouts tab. You can delete individual workouts, but be careful as this cannot be undone.
commonQuestions.whatIsAILA: AILA is your AI Personal Trainer. She can analyze your workout history, provide progression recommendations, answer fitness questions, and search the web for the latest research.

tips: Log your workouts consistently for better AI recommendations
The AI needs at least a few completed workouts to generate meaningful insights
Use the Progress page to identify exercises where you're plateauing
Chat with AILA if you're unsure about form, programming, or nutrition
Set your weight unit preference in Settings before starting to avoid confusion
Add notes to sets to remember important details (e.g., 'felt easy' or 'struggled')
The timer helps track total workout duration - no need to start/stop it manually
Use category filters in AI Recommendations to get focused advice for specific muscle groups
